snippet: Scientists and military experts working for the National Research Council are critical of the Obama administration’s strategy and suggest changes to the United States’ antimissile system.
abstract: Panel of scientists and military experts working for the National Research Council concludes that the nation's protections against missile attacks suffer from major shortcomings, leaving the United States vulnerable to some kinds of long-range strikes; panel recommends that Pres Obama shift course by expanding a system inherited from Pres George W Bush and setting aside the final part of an antimissile strategy unveiled in 2009.
lead_paragraph: Scientists and military experts working for the National Research Council are critical of the Obama administration’s strategy and suggest changes to the United States’ antimissile system.

headline.seo: U.S. Missile Defense Protections Are Called Vulnerable
headline.main: U.S. Missile Defense Strategy Is Flawed, Expert Panel Finds
headline.print_headline: U.S. Missile Defense Strategy Is Flawed, Panel Finds

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
